Hi, 

Do you have plans to upgrade MVVM Light for Windows 8 Consumer Preview? Do you know when?

Hi,

Of course. I hope to have code ready and tested tomorrow, DLLs available by the end of the weekend. However project templates and installer will take a bit longer. Stay tuned to my blog (blog.galasoft.ch) for an announcement.

Cheers
Laurent

Hi,

what about adding a RaisePropertyChanged method for Windows 8 that doesn't require propertyName parameter by using CallerMemberName attribute?
Here is an example: http://danrigby.com/2012/03/01/inotifypropertychanged-the-net-4-5-way/

Hi,

Yeah that's the plan. I have other things with higher priority first though. But I have this item on my backlog.

Cheers
Laurent

Here is an example: http://danrigby.com/2012/03/01/inotifypropertychanged-the-net-4-5-way/

Hi,

thank you very much.

It would be great also to have a navigation system to navigate between pages from viewmodel.
What about also using NETFX_CORE conditional symbol (that is the default when creating a new project) instead of WIN8?

I think MVVM Light Toolkit is the best MVVM framework because it's easy to use and fast to learn.

Hi,

For the navigation, it is a little too specific for MVVM Light, my philosophy is to provide a basis series of components and to allow people to build on top of this. For example some developers have created the WP7Contrib project that builds on top of MVVM Light. I will consider it though, maybe for a later version.

This is a good point regarding the precompiler directive, I just want yo make sure with the team what exactly they use this for, to see if it is indeed uniquely identifying Win8 projects.

Thanks a lot for the feedback.

Cheers
Laurent
